A: 1. Peaceful Co-existence means different people living together in _ (peace/disagreement/conflict/war)
2. When people live together without any disagreement or fight, there is peaceful _ (co-existence/argument/war/competition)
3. Who taught us to live peaceful with others? (a) Jesus (b) Moses (c) David (d) Abraham
4. Jesus advised us to _ a person who offends us (forgive/punish/ignore/fight)
5. God wants us to live _ with others in the community (peacefully/separately/alone/far)
6. Which brothers reconciled after one took the other's blessings? (a) Esau and Jacob (b) Cain and Abel (c) Moses and Aaron (d) Peter and Paul
7. Philemon and Onesimus are examples of people who desired peaceful _ (co-existence/war/separation/disagreement)
8. Isaac and _ are examples of people who lived happily together (Abimelech/Abraham/Lot/Joseph)
9. Abraham prevented a quarrel between himself and his nephew _ (Lot/Jacob/Esau/Isaac)
10. It is _ to show love to others (good/bad/wrong/difficult)
11. We should _ those who are around us (consider/ignore/avoid/forget)
12. Jesus wants us to show love and _ to people (hospitality/anger/hatred/jealousy)
13. We should tell others the truth and be _ (open-minded/closed-minded/secretive/dishonest)
14. Which two people in the bible showed unselfish love to each other? (a) Jonathan and David (b) Saul and David (c) Goliath and David (d) Moses and Pharaoh
15. Jonathan loved David as his own _ (soul/brother/friend/king)
16. King Saul planned to _ David (kill/help/marry/promote)
17. Who saved David by telling him Saul's plans? (a) Jonathan (b) Samuel (c) Goliath (d) Jesse
18. Jonathan hid David in a place far away from _ sight (Saul's/Jonathan's/David's/Samuel's)
19. Jonathan and David made a _ (covenant/treaty/pact/agreement)
20. Pupils and everybody in society should show _ to one another (love/hatred/indifference/dislike)
B: 1. Peaceful co-existence means different people living together in _________?
2. Who advised us to forgive those who offend us?
3. Which two brothers reconciled after Jacob took the blessings?
4. Who loved David as his own soul?
C: 1. What is the meaning of peaceful co-existence?
2. Name two pairs of individuals from the Bible who showed desire for peaceful co-existence.
3. According to the text, what is one moral responsibility regarding love for others?
4. Describe the nature of the relationship between Jonathan and David.
5. State one way pupils should show love to one another.
answers_C: Different people living together in peace.
Esau and Jacob, Isaac and Abimelech.
To show love and hospitality to people.
They showed unselfish love; Jonathan loved David as his own soul.
